original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽13.19. Atītārammaṇattika🔽Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naatītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Atītārammaṇaṁ
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi        atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā atīta ārammaṇa
translated: The forward and reverse order of conditions according to the Dhamma, the text of the Triad system🔽.. The triad on past object

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca napaccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca naatītārammaṇo ca napaccuppannārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāgatārammaṇo ca napaccuppannārammaṇo ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naatītārammaṇo ca naanāgatārammaṇo
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā atīta ārammaṇam dhamma  paṭicca na paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā atīta ārammaṇam dhamma  paṭicca na atīta ārammaṇaḥ ca na paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na anāgata ārammaṇaḥ ca na paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā  uppajjanti hetu paccayāḥ atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na atīta ārammaṇaḥ ca na anāgata ārammaṇaḥ
translated: With a past object as condition, there is a future object. With a past object as condition, there is a present object. With a past object as condition, there is a past and a future object. With a past object as condition, there is a past and a present object. With a past object as condition, there is a future and a present object. With a past object as condition, there is a past, future, and present object.🔽With a future object as condition, there is a past object. With a future object as condition, there is a present object. With a future object as condition, there is a past and a future object. With a future object as condition, there is a past and a present object. With a future object as condition, there is a future and a present object. With a future object as condition, there is a past, future, and present object.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naatītārammaṇo ca
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na atīta ārammaṇaḥ ca
translated: With a present object as condition, there is a past object. With a present object as condition, there is a future object. With a present object as condition, there is a past and a future object. With a present object as condition, there is a past and a present object. With a present object as condition, there is a future and a present object. With a present object as condition, there is a past, future, and present object.

original: naanāgatārammaṇo ca napaccuppannārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na anāgata ārammaṇaḥ ca na paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: and from thoughts that are not past and not future and not present, thoughts that are not past and not future and not present arise with root-cause as condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe nava pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: With root-cause as condition, there are twenty-one. With object as condition, there are nine. … With non-disappearance as condition, there are twenty-one.
